15221.content:
From a very young age, Ryan knew he was not like the other children. His parents freaked when they saw him move vertically as a toddler, even more so when he began flying through walls or turning invisible. The concept of gravity was difficult for Ryan to understand, partly since he was completely unaffected by it, and partly since his telekinesis meant he could make anything float anyway. But being a fundamentally good-natured boy, he learnt to copy his parents and walk with his feet touching the ground.

One wouldn't have guessed from his cute little smile that Ryan had powers beyond human imagination. He looked like just about any other boy - short brown hair, blue eyes and so on. He typically dressed in simple t-shirts and shorts, often whatever his parents could find in his size at the thrift shop. If anything gave him away, it was that he was a little taller than his peers and had some very faint outlines of his super-strong muscles visible, although his skin also retained its softness. Of course, if Ryan ever did want to flex his muscles people would stand back in shock, but as it stood he simply appeared sweet, cute and happy.

At the time Ryan's parents lived in a small townhouse, in a middle class suburb. His mother fell ill often, given the stresses involved in raising a boy who seemed to possess limitless power. Her family were religious nuts who would have been convinced Ryan was some kind of demon. His dad was forced to return to work to provide for the family. Ryan was always helping out around the house, but often he unintentionally caused more trouble than he intended due to his childish naivity and incredible array of powers. For example, when he volunteered to water a pot plant, the torrent of water he blasted was strong enough to instantly kill the plant, damage the wall on the other side, and flood nearly the whole house in a flash.

Then there was the pesky question of why Ryan had these supernatural powers in the first place. His parents literally consulted comic books on parenting advice, since nobody had raised a superhero before. As far as everyone else was concerned, superheroes didn't exist. Of course they hid him from the outside world, partly to protect him from what the others might think, but also to protect the rest of the world from what Ryan could do. Nobody seemed to know or understand why Ryan had these God-like powers, and sometimes that made Ryan feel sad, like an outcast. In truth, that was because nobody actually did know. Sometimes Ryan would read the minds of people around him for clues, but it was futile - there was no explanation, he simply had powers and that was that.

Eventually his parents decided to send him to preschool. They kept warning him all week not to use his powers in preschool, and of course, Ryan promised he wouldn't. Within only an hour of his arriving, however, a little girl knocked over a tower of blocks Ryan had built and laughed at Ryan about it. Immediately the poor girl suffered third-degree burns from Ryan's laser vision in a barely-controlled fit of rage. Luckily, Ryan managed to stop himself and use his healing powers to heal the girl before any of the caregivers could see what happened, but the girl cried and told everyone. The center staff thought she had too much of an imagination, but of course Ryan's parents were furious when they heard. All the students, too, became very afraid of Ryan.

That was the first and last time Ryan was allowed to go to kindy. Since then he'd done lots of work to control his emotions, seem like he was obeying the laws of physics, and just behave like a normal kid. His parents, fearful of any scrutiny, moved to a small secluded block in a rural town of less than a hundred people. A single school served the community, with teenagers commuting to a nearby larger town. The whole place was dull, but it was a much more appropriate environment for raising a boy with super-powers.

Over time Ryan did become more and more helpful. When his father needed to fix the car, Ryan would lift it up for him, for example. He still struggled with some basic concepts such as the difference between "heavy" and "light", since nothing was heavy for him, but he was learning as well as he could. His parents also learned Ryan had a fun, playful side to him. On Halloween he'd turn into a ghost, possessing things and making spooky noises, for example. He'd also make his parents breakfast in bed every morning - working at super-speed it only took him a blink of an eye. On the whole, his parents thought that he was a handful, but they were lucky that he was earnestly trying to make the best of his powers for good. They even read him comic stories sometimes as he went to bed. Ryan enjoyed the stories, but his biggest wish was to just be a normal boy so he could play with others his age.

Eventually, Ryan turned six. Deciding they couldn't homeschool him, and that both of them were incredibly burnt out after taking care of such a unique boy for six years, his parents reluctantly enrolled him in a local school. Ryan was extremely happy at the news, cheering excitedly. After more stern warnings from his parents, he sincerely swore never to use his powers at school, no matter what happened. He also promised to act exactly like a normal child while around other people - even pretending to fall or be hurt, if necessary. Ryan did his best. His parents were worried because apparently acting wasn't among Ryan's super-powers, but after a few weeks of practice he had the basics down.

Ryan's sixth birthday, which was on the weekend before he was due to begin school, was attended by his soon-to-be teacher, Mrs Rogers. She got him his own schoolbag, and helped his parents with the other equipment he needed for school. She told him how good it was that he was excited to start learning, which made Ryan very happy. He had a big chocolate cake with "Congratulations" iced on to it, and spent most of the rest of the day playing with the superhero action figures his dad got him. Both of his parents were happy that while Mrs Rodgers was there, he didn't make the figures come to life with his telekinesis or something. He was even running at the speed of a normal kid, stomping down on the ground appropriately as he did so, while holding up the figures and making wooshing sounds. Where most parents would have been upset at the boy running indoors, Ryan's parents both praised him for it afterwards. He was well on his way to learning how to act like a regular kid.

On the morning of his first day in school, Ryan got up before dawn. Excitedly he had himself ready and packed some hours before he actually had to go. He was feeling a little nervous about meeting the other kids his age and making some friends. But would he be able to control himself and his powers?
15221.title: Origin Story!

152211.content:
Before he knew it, Ryan was hanging up his red schoolbag in the back of the classroom on a coat-hanger with his name above it. His mother had walked with him to school. She was almost as nervous as Ryan was, hoping not to see a repeat of what had happened in preschool. Thankfully, Ryan was on his best behavior, smiling and looking curiously around his colorful new classroom with his cute blue eyes. His mother gave him a kiss goodbye before leaving the young superhuman boy in the class.

No sooner had she left the door than she heard a crash behind her. Immediately she dashed back into the class, afraid Ryan had done something terrible again. Instead, she saw two boys playing with monster trucks on the ground, smashing them against each other. Ryan was watching them with curiosity, but he wasn't involved in their game. Relieved, his mother left the room and went home.

"Hey" said Ryan shyly, walking over to the two boys "What are you doing?"
"We're playing monster trucks" said one of the boys "I'm Alex, and this is Henry. Want to join in?"
"Sure" said Ryan, practically leaping to the floor before picking up a large blue truck toy and rolling it along the ground.

Ryan, Alex and Henry had lots of fun driving around their cars and crashing them into things. They told little stories with their trucks and imagined they were real truck drivers. Ryan secretly hoped that when he grew up, he would have a normal job like being a monster truck driver, not having to give away his identity with his divine powers. He was having fun just playing around with the other boys like a normal kid. Alex and Henry had no idea that this new kid was himself well over a billion, billion, billion times stronger, faster and more powerful than any monster truck.

Soon the school bell rang, spooking Ryan, although he managed to stop himself from immediately destroying the school's bell system. Alex and Henry groaned. "That means we have to pack up and go sit over there" he explained. Ryan nodded and helped the boys pack away the toys, before sitting down with all the other students. When put side-by-side with the others, Ryan's slightly larger, lightly muscular body was somewhat more apparent. He slumped down his shoulders and leaned back a bit to blend in more with the other students.

Mrs Rodgers took her seat at the front of the class. After greeting everyone, she introduced Ryan as the newest member of the class. Everyone turned around and stared at him. Now Ryan had to seriously resist his natural instinct to turn invisible - he didn't like being the center of attention. He just wanted to be normal, like everyone else. Of course, as the new student, this would be impossible even if he wasn't the most powerful kid in the universe. Seeing the embarrassment Ryan was facing, Mrs Rodgers quickly changed the subject, getting the class started on practicing writing their letters instead. Ryan was more than a little annoyed with himself - the school day had barely begun and already he'd struggled to avoid using his powers several times.

At morning break, Ryan sat with the rest of his class beside the school playground. His mum had packed him some cheese sandwiches - Ryan would tear off a bite with his perfect white teeth, then use his heat breath to secretly turn it into a toasted sandwich in his mouth. The only evidence was a faint whisp of smoke from Ryan's nostrils every time he did it, but he was mostly left on his own while eating so there was no chance of getting caught.

Soon after Ryan had finished his sandwiches and put away his lunchbox, Alex and Henry came over to him. "Hey, what was your name again?" asked Alex.
"I'm Ryan" said Ryan, grinning shyly.
"We're just about to play ball tag on the playground" said Alex "Want to join us?"
Ryan's face lit up with enthusiasm. "Yeah!" he cheered.
"Alright, you're in!" chuckled Alex, before tossing a tennis ball at Ryan. Immediately Alex and Henry ran off onto the playground.

Ryan let them run off for a moment before softly throwing the tennis ball. Without really thinking about it, Ryan made the ball coast through the air like a homing missile, hitting Henry as he was trying to climb up a slide. The ball hit him so hard that Henry actually fell off the side of the slide, which surprised Ryan as he had tried to throw the ball "softly" ... but luckily a moment later, Henry got up to show he wasn't hurt.

"Wow, great throw!" called Alex.
"I'll get you for that!" said Henry.
Ryan smirked. "You can't catch me!" he said, running off to some monkey bars.

Although Ryan was doing his very best to conceal his unbounded athletic talent, it didn't take Alex and Henry long to figure out that they were no match for Ryan. Every ball Henry threw at Ryan seemed to miss, and besides that Ryan was incredibly fast, strong and nimble for a kid. After a while Ryan would purposefully stand in the way of Henry's throws so that he'd have a turn being in sometimes, and deliberately miss a few of his throws. But even then, his natural strength and precision was impossible to ignore - even when he was missing a shot, it was somehow obvious it was deliberate.

"How'd you get so good at this game?" asked Alex, lying on the ground panting with exhaustion.
"I don't know" lied Ryan. But Ryan wasn't a very good liar, and both Alex and Henry knew there was more to him than met the eye. Ryan was worried they wouldn't want to play with him anymore.
"We should play again at lunch" suggested Alex "That was the most intense game I've played in a while."
"Yeah" said Henry "And it's so much better when I'm not being annoyed by..."

Suddenly, somebody snatched the tennis ball out of Alex's hand. The figure stood above them imposingly, silhouetted against the sun.
"Maybe I spoke too soon" gulped Henry.
"Well well well, if it isn't my little cousin" said the big figure. Ryan guessed he must have been at least four years older.
"Give me my ball back!" demanded Alex, standing up. Henry and Ryan stood up too, behind him.
"Maybe at lunch time - it's fun to watch you little midgets beg me for stuff" laughed Henry's cousin, before gesturing at Ryan "Who's your new friend anyway?"
"I'm Ryan" said Ryan, stepping forward before Alex or Henry could respond. Face to face, Henry's cousin was surprised at the courage of the young boy.
Alex, however, pushed Ryan back. At first Ryan was getting angry, but soon realized Alex was doing the right thing. Ryan needed to control himself, or else Henry would watch his cousin be vaporized in an instant. At the front of the confrontation was the last place Ryan needed to be.
"Don't worry about him" said Alex "Just give me my ball back or I'll tell the teacher."
Suddenly the schoolbell rang. "Tell her and you'll never see your ball again" said Henry's cousin, holding the ball up tauntingly.

Ryan read Henry's mind to see what he was thinking. Apparently this wasn't the first time this had happened. It happened all the time at home as well. Henry's cousin just loved teasing people to get a reaction out of them. He loved it when Henry cried or became angry. But of course, Henry was too small and weak to do anything about it. Alex was much better at dealing with bullies than Henry was - he was obviously a natural leader. That was why Henry always stuck as close to him as he could.

Ryan felt that he couldn't simply let this slide. He had to do something. A heroic instinct welled up inside him, to protect his new friends, without giving away his identity. Using his telekinesis, he very slowly manipulated Henry's cousin's shoelaces, first so they untied, and then...

"Argh!" cried Henry's cousin as he tripped over himself.
Alex, Henry and Ryan had already started walking back to class when they saw the bully fall to the ground, dropping the ball in the process. All three boys laughed hysterically.
"Darn shoelaces!" said Henry's cousin, picking up the ball and dragging himself to class.
152211.title: First day in school

1522111.content:
After a boring maths lesson, Alex, Henry and Ryan ate lunch together.
"Are you going to tell a teacher?" Ryan asked Alex.
"If he doesn't give it back like he promised" Alex answered "He usually just pretends he owns the ball."
Ryan looked back down at his laser-vision-cut sliced apple. He knew he wasn't supposed to use his powers at school, and although it had felt really good to help Henry get revenge on his cousin, he still had to act just like he was a totally normal boy.

Soon, the three boys saw Henry's cousin eating a doughnut on his own. "You midgets want your ball back?" he sneered.
"Yes please" replied Alex.
"How about right after I do THIS!" said Henry's cousin, before throwing the ball as hard as he could at Henry. Ryan considered catching it, but realised that the ball was moving too fast for any kid to catch. All he could do was watch as the ball struck Henry in the chest, hurting him and making him fall over. Henry's cousin laughed as the ball bounced back into his hand.
"Now one for you!" he said, doing the same thing to Alex. In just a moment, both Alex and Henry were down on the ground, writhing in pain, while Henry's cousin laughed and turned to face Ryan. Ryan had hoped he wouldn't have to do anything. But how could he when his new friends were hurt. Even though he could faintly hear Alex groaning at him to run away.
"Your turn, new kid!" sneered Henry's cousin as he threw the ball straight at him.

The sneer turned to shock as Ryan easily caught the ball with one hand. Alex and Henry had stopped wincing in pain and were looking at Ryan, stunned.

"Urgh ... nobody catches my throws you little twerp!" shouted Henry's cousin in frustration, throwing a roundhouse kick at Ryan.
Ryan calmly lifted Henry's cousin's leg up as it sailed towards him, causing Henry's cousin to lose his footing and fall backward to the ground. The older boy screamed in pain and humiliation at being so easily beaten by a little kid.

"Oh yeah, and one last thing" said Ryan, aiming the ball at the prone and defenseless boy.
"No ... please don't ..." begged Henry's cousin.
"Doesn't feel so good when somebody's doing it to you, huh?" asked Ryan "Oh well, too late now."

And even with the greatest of restraint, Ryan's thrown ball delivered a bruise with his throw that was at least double as painful as those Alex and Henry had received. It was a miracle Henry's cousin didn't suffer any broken bones. He yowled and hollered, rolling about on the ground, entirely humbled by the infinitely superior little Ryan.

"Come on" said Ryan, helping his friends to their feet and handing Alex the ball "Let's go play our game. I don't think he'll bother us anymore."
Alex and Henry just stared at Ryan, unsure of what to say. Behind them, Henry's cousin was squealing in pain.
Eventually Alex spoke up. "I'm still hurt a bit where he threw a ball at me" he said, lifting up his Transformers-branded shirt to expose a tennis-ball shaped bruise.
"Oh ... right" said Ryan. He'd forgotten the other boys didn't have healing powers like he did. And he couldn't use his powers to heal them because he still wanted to keep his powers a secret ... or had that ship sailed?

"So uh ... how exactly are you doing these things?" asked Henry "I mean, you beat Alex in ball tag. Alex is, like, one of the best in the school. And now you just injured my cousin, the biggest bully in the school, like it was nothing!"
"I ... I'm sorry ... I didn't mean to ..." began Ryan, upset with himself. Yet again he'd allowed his emotions to get the better of him. Although he was trying his best to restrain his use of powers, he figured he'd just messed it all up. Perhaps Henry and Alex would never play with him again.
Just as he was thinking these things, Alex rested a comforting hand on the superpowered boy's shoulder. "Hey - it's ok" he said, as Ryan seemed on the verge of crying "There's nothing wrong with being talented at sport. I am too, I guess - I like playing ball tag anyway. Actually, to me, it's a GOOD thing. You can keep us safe from bullies and honestly, that ball tag game we played was so much fun. In fact, you should play on my soccer team, too."
"Really?" asked Ryan, wiping a tear from his eye.
"Yeah ... we're called the junior tigers. Just ask your parents if you can play."

Ryan felt very lucky to have found such good friends, even if he knew his parents would never allow him to play. After all, when playing sports against a kid like Ryan, there was much potential for things to go wrong. But it was the sentiment that meant so much more. Here he finally had friends, who seemed to accept him for who he was, not always growl at him like his parents did.

"Alright" said Ryan "Let's go find a nicer spot to rest"
And so the three boys left Henry's cousin to recover on his own, taking their tennis ball with them. They shared jokes and laughed about how boring maths was. Ryan didn't want to admit he found it all really easy. Alex and Henry were still learning to count and read, after all. But Ryan found it a little easier to feign ignorance than clumsinesss or weakness, as he was still learning to control his overdeveloped motor skills himself. In the background, Ryan used his super-hearing to listen to Henry's cousin as he tried to explain to a teacher that he'd been beaten up by a five year old. The teacher had to suppress a laugh at the big bully, not believing him for a moment. Ryan was glad, because he certainly didn't want his parents to find out.

In the afternoon, the class was doing painting. Ryan drew a very rough picture of a monster truck for Henry to try to cheer him up, which somehow still seemed like a priceless work of abstract art no matter how "bad" he tried to make it look, but luckily the others didn't really notice - Henry drew a soccer stadium for Alex, and Alex drew a picture of some flowers for some reason. He gave them to Mrs Rodgers at the end of class, who seemed very happy about it. Nobody drew a picture for Ryan, but Ryan didn't mind too much. He was happy about finally having made friends. He knew that certainly Alex, and a to a lesser extent Henry, had wondered about his apparent physical power, but they weren't reacting like his parents would have. Instead they considered themselves lucky to be friends with such a special boy as Ryan, and Ryan considered himself lucky to have made such good friends.

At the end of the day, Ryan's mother came to pick him up. Ryan smiled and waved goodbye to his new friends.
"Did you have fun today?" asked his mum.
"Yeah" replied Ryan enthusiastically.
"And did you ... behave yourself?" she continued.
"Mostly" said Ryan.
Ryan's mother wasn't terribly convinced by his response, but since everything seemed to be alright she didn't immediately question it further.

You screamed her name over and over, but she didn't hear you. Next thing you saw was her foot come right down on you.

You thought you were dead, but you noticed that you were still stuck to her foot alive. Moment's later you pushed yourself off of her foot and went back to your room. Thinking how on Earth you became this small, you remembered thinking about being small. This hinted that if you thought you were bigger, you would grow back to normal size.

Beginning to think you were at a bigger size, you noticed that you began to grow big again. You thought harder and harder in excitement to return to normal, you saw that you grew faster. However, you stopped growing when you returned to your original height.

Figuring out how to become big and small was great, but one question remained in your mind. How you were able to survive being stepped on by your sister.

Testing this again could be risky, but was worth trying. You heard your other sister finishing her shower (who during the time was in the 8th grade). You ran to the bathroom and quickly shrunk yourself down. When she opened the door you ran underneath her foot. Then when it came down on you, you realized that you were again stuck underneath her foot and alive.

Before you could unstick yourself, you heard your sister say "What the heck is that" then began raising her foot. You began freaking out on what she would do if she found you like this. You wished that you could turn in to an object like one of those gummy hand toys.

You felt different all of a sudden and when you saw your sisters face she said "Oh it's one of Luke's toys on the ground". She went to your room and tossed you in there. Shocked about what just happened, you figured out how to turn back into a human and restored yourself back to your normal height.

Curiosity filled your mind on what else you could turn into. You began thinking you were a pencil and suddenly turned into one. Then thought about turn into a toy car. Sadly you couldn't move yourself when you were the toy car. The next thing you wanted to see is if you could turn into another person. You thought about one of your classmates, Josh from school. Checking the mirror in your room to see if it worked. You saw Josh in the mirror and then turned back into your back into yourself.

"Hey where's Anna and Winter" you asked. (Winter was your oldest sister and Anna was your older sister). "Winter took the bus to school and Anna walked to school already" you mom said. Since you already lived near your elementary school you and Anna could walk over. However, Winter has to take the school bus, since the high school isn't walking distance.

"Alright, well I'm going now then" you said, but before you left you checked the clock which said 7:20. Luckily this was around the time one of your neighbors head to school. Her name was Erin, she was in your grade, and both of you had the same class together.

Walking out side you check around to make sure no one was looking before you shrunk down, so you could catch a ride on Erin. You saw a guy wearing a black coat looking the other way, so you shrunk down quickly. Moments later, you saw Erin walking by and immediately ran toward her shoe (Note: you don't have a foot fetish or shrink fetish, but this is the closest you can get to getting a ride on your friend). You jumped right on top, then shrunk yourself smaller and wrapped yourself under her shoe lace. Once you got on school campus, and began passing the restrooms. You quickly got off her shoe and ran into the boys restroom. This way you could restore your height without anyone noticing.

Once you reached one of the stalls in the restroom you quickly grew back. You found your stuff that you left there on Friday still in the stall. During after school times, you would hang back to steal the keys to the restroom (by shrinking of course). Then hid your stuff such as clothes and your bag for Monday; your other pairs of clothes you had on before you shrunk were left at your house. This way you could get a ride on Erin and have your stuff at school. After hiding your stuff you put the keys back in the janitor's room.

Getting dressed again, you left the restroom and went to your class. Going through school was pretty easy, since you studied most of your work outside of school on the computer. During recess, you never really hung out with the other students, so you stayed inside classes doing homework or reading something. And for lunch, you had to go to the cafeteria to eat and when you went to the play ground you just sat down thinking on what to do after school. You never really played around with your power's to much during school, since you didn't want other people to start wondering where you went. However it wasn't like a lot of other kids came into conversation with you, so they wouldn't notice if you had left already.

After school you would hang out by the jungle gym until the janitors finished up and left. During this time is when you began leaving your bag which had you extra set of clothes for tomorrow with all of your homework finished, all in the restroom stall.
